general.headline: Partner - Transfer Pricing
general.description:
Graeme is a Partner in Deloitte’s Australian transfer pricing team, and is focused on building and developing Deloitte's connection with Western Sydney businesses. Graeme has over 16 years’ experience in public practice with Deloitte, in both Australia and the United States, and his clients have included multinational corporations in a variety of industries with operations centered in a range of different countries.

Graeme has had considerable involvement in all facets of transfer pricing in Australia and has recently worked on a number of bilateral Advance Pricing Arrangement projects for companies in the technology, consumer goods and resources trading sectors.

Graeme recently spent time with Deloitte’s US practice.  During this period, he worked with companies on many aspects of setting and reviewing cross border pricing arrangements and was involved in a number of tax efficient restructuring implementation projects.  Graeme also had extensive exposure to FAS 109 and Fin 48 projects, including advising a number of clients with regard to the review and quantification of transfer pricing related tax reserves.

Graeme's experience with our Australian and US transfer pricing teams have involved many audit defense projects, completing documentation and planning studies; and assisting with negotiations relating to Advance Pricing Agreements for a number of Australian and US companies.

general.headline: Five V Capital

jobs.description:
Five V Capital is a private equity focussed fund manager based in Sydney, Australia. Through our two Funds, we have over $100 million of long term capital available to pursue investment opportunities, bringing our total funds under management to over $180 million.

The core principle of our business is alignment. We believe in the alignment between our team and our investors. The partners of Five V are the biggest investors in our funds, and we stand aligned with those who have entrusted us with their capital. We share risk and we share reward. As a result, Five V has an extraordinary group of investors forming a powerful and unique network across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and Europe. 

Five V also believes in a full alignment between ourselves and the businesses we invest in. We seek to contribute strategically through a collaborative approach to allow businesses to reach their potential and to create value for all stakeholders. Our team is dedicated to assisting our portfolio companies, leveraging our extensive international experience and networks. We facilitate a fast and efficient decision making and execution process. 

We invest in leading businesses across a range of sectors including healthcare, retail, media, consumer, technology, and financial services. The Five V focus is on businesses with an enterprise value of between $20 million and $150 million, where we can take a significant ownership position alongside our partners. Five V seeks established, leading businesses which generate sustainable earnings and cashflow, and have opportunities for growth. Our aim is to support such businesses to build sustainable leading positions in their markets in Australia or overseas.

We are fortunate enough to be investors in a number of great companies including: UHG; RateSetter; Education Perfect; Probe Group; Ascender; Madman Entertainment; Canva; SiteMinder; ParcelPoint and Fluent Retail.

Alongside my fellow snow reporter I had to research and prepare reports for daily online and radio publication as well as TV reports several times a week. Filming was often in difficult conditions - snowing and windy - which required skiing to various locations on the mountain. TV reports were broadcast regularly on FOX Sports, Sky News and Channels 9 and 10.

In addition, we had to manage Thredbo's social media accounts - @thredboresort with 40k+ Instagram followers. I contributed daily to the Thredbo blog page, creating various stories on events, promotion of upcoming deals and general creative writing promoting the resort. We also filmed and were featured in Facebook live streams, including publication to the Daily Telegraph facebook page with 1.2m+ followers.

My season in Thredbo was a varied, exciting and fast-paced experience which required adaptability, commitment, creativity and enthusiasm.

schools.schoolName: Australia and New Zealand School of Government
schools.description: The ProgramThe Executive Fellows Program (EFP) is a three-week residential program designed to enable senior executives to strengthen core skills needed to manage public sector organisations effectively in challenging times.The program is modelled on the best offerings from the US and the UK, but relevant to the Australian and New Zealand public sector environments including a focus on key international trends, particularly in the Asia region.The curriculum is a dynamic mix of theory, case studies and practical exercises, premised on the notion of the role of the public sector leaders as creators of public value. It is taught by leading local and international academics including faculty from the Harvard Kennedy School, as well as senior practitioners across the public sector that complement this academic rigor.

The CEW Leaders Program aims to inspire women to take on more senior leadership roles and enhance their career and personal growth opportunities.The program, supported by some of Australia’s leading businesses and organisations, brings together women from a wide range of different industries and sectors, providing them with a unique opportunity to grow personally and professionally through:-Learning from some of Australia’s most outstanding women in leadership,-Gaining new insights and strategies to achieve their potential as Ieaders.-Discussing issues, reviewing personal priorities and,-Sharing and learning from their and others’ experiences,Meeting monthly over the course of a year, participants in the Leadership Program will learn to ‘think beyond the obvious’ with their career progression and personal success and better understand how to operate effectively in different organisational environments.

general.headline: Partner at King & Wood Mallesons
general.description:
Senior partner in King & Wood Mallesons competition and regulatory team in Melbourne.
 
Before joining a major law firm in 1998, was a senior legal advisor to the ACCC. Since joining private practice, has acted in merger and joint venture approvals, ACCC investigations and litigation, and infrastructure access disputes. Extensive expertise in large-scale litigation, having represented BHP Billiton in the long running Fortescue Metals Group infrastructure access proceedings in the Competition Tribunal, Federal Court and High Court. Extensive experience in merger and joint venture approvals in a variety of industries, including recently acting for the Western Australian Government in the Verve/Synergy power corporation remerger and Telstra in the proposed acquistion of Adam Internet. Other recent experience includes immunity applications and conduct investigations and litigation, such as leading Flight Centre's defence of the ACCC’s test case on principal/agent price agreements. During 2011/2012 was Chairman of the Competition & Consumer Committee of the Law Council of Australia and played a leading role in the Committee’s consultations with the ACCC and Federal Government about policy and enforcement matters. For a number of years has been listed as a leading competition and litigation lawyer in Chambers Global and Best Lawyers. Included in International Who’s Who of Competition Lawyers and Economists. Presented in a plenary session at the International Competition Network 2013 Annual Conference in Warsaw.

general.headline: Senior Associate at Herbert Smith Freehills

jobs.description:
Scott practices in commercial litigation and has extensive experience in a broad range of disputes with a focus on construction, mining and international arbitration. 

Scott's experience includes acting for:

Samsung C&T Corporation, the EPC Contractor on the multi-billion dollar Roy Hill iron ore mining, rail and port project in the Pilbara in relation to numerous claims, disputes, adjudications and project issues with Forge Group and Duro Felguera Australia Pty Limited including an application for public examinations under the Corporations Act 2001 (Cth), various hearings and appeals concerning calls by Samsung C&T on performance bonds, adjudications under the Construction Contracts Act 2004 (WA) and related judicial review proceedings and SIAC international arbitration proceedings.

InterOil Corporation in relation to claims for breach of pre-emption provisions over rights in Elk-Antelope gas field in Papua New Guinea which were successfully defended in an ICC arbitration held in London.

A subsidiary of an ASX listed iron ore mining company in an international arbitration relating to alleged breach of an iron ore offtake agreement.

The receivers appointed by Australia and New Zealand Banking Group to Burrup Fertilisers Pty Ltd in relation to the recovery of debts in excess of $600m, the sale of the assets of Pankaj and Radhika Oswal and related litigation.

Brookfield Rail Pty Ltd in relation to various aspects of rail access, including assisting with Supreme Court of Western Australia proceedings commenced by Co-operative Bulk Handling Ltd and arbitration under the Railways (Access) Code 2000 (WA).

The administrators of a public company in relation to claims challenging the validity of the administrators’ appointment which were successfully defended in the Supreme Court of Western Australia.

Bis Industries Limited in relation to a $56m dispute with a vendor in relation to the amount of profit based consideration payable for the purchase of a business.
Disputes

Scott assisted clients with a variety of corporate advisory and due diligence work.
He was a member of the Allens team that advised Leighton Holdings Limited, and its wholly owned subsidiary, Leighton Contractors on the sale of its HWE Iron Ore entities and assets to BHP Billiton in Western Australia for a sale price, subject to working capital adjustments and final documentation, of about A$705 million.

At the State Solicitor's Office Scott was involved in a broad variety of litigation and advisings work on behalf of the State government spanning major construction litigation, including representing the Commissioner of Main Roads in a dispute with Thiess concerning the design and construction of the Kwinana Freeway extension, regulatory prosecutions and town planning, acting as counsel in the Magistrates Court, District Court and Supreme Court of Western Australia.

As an Articled Clerk at the State Solicitor's Office, Scott assisted with a variety of matters on behalf of State government departments and instrumentalities, rotating through the advisings, litigation, commercial and land claims divisions of the State Solicitor's Office as well as undertaking external rotations at the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions and the Parliamentary Counsel's Office.

Natasha Andrew is the WorkCover managing lawyer in the Ringwood office. She acts for clients who have suffered from an injury, illness or disease arising out of, or in the course of their employment. Before joining Maurice Blackburn in December 2006, Natasha spent a number of years working both as a teacher and an academic in the School of Graduate Studies at Monash University.

Natasha is a member of the Law Institute of Victoria, Australian Lawyers' Alliance, Victorian Women Lawyers and is an executive committee member of the Later Lawyers Network. She is also a member of the firm's Women's Law Section and Social Justice committees. Natasha features in this story about access to female lawyers.

Natasha also volunteers at the Eastern Community Legal Centre.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at Maurice Blackburn Lawyers
general.description:
I am the CEO of Maurice Blackburn Lawyers, Australia’s leading social justice law firm. I lead the firm from our Melbourne office.

I was drawn to human rights and class action law because I am passionate about helping people who otherwise would not have access to justice. For the rule of law to be meaningful, everyone has to have the ability to bring matters before the courts, not just the rich and powerful. I love the opportunity to help people fight for justice when they have been treated unfairly. 

I started my legal career at Maurice Blackburn, then took the opportunity to work as a political adviser before returning to the firm in 2006. 
My achievements include:
•	establishing our Australian commercial litigation funding business Claims Funding Australia
•	leading our Social Justice Practice through a period in which MB has become renown for high-impact public interest litigation
•	leading the NAB collateralised debt shareholder class action team, which secured a settlement of $115 million for shareholders; and
•	leading the legal campaign which successfully secured the release of 111 Australian-born children and their families from detention.

jobs.jobTitle: Associate in Wills & Estates Litigation Group
jobs.description:
I practise exclusively in the area of wills and estates disputes with experience across Victorian, New South Wales and Western Australian jurisdictions.

My practice covers:

Acting for both Plaintiffs and Defendants in various estate litigation disputes including: 
● Part IV applications for provision/further provision from estates
● Challenges to Will validity, including lack of testamentary capacity and undue influence
● Applications to remove executors
● Applications under s 15 to force executors to prove Will or renounce Probate
● Executors in dispute with co-executors
● Claims for superannuation death benefits 
● Applications for executor's commission
● Recovery of money misappropriated from an estate
● Disputes over inter vivos transfers
● Claims for breach of trust
● Elder abuse 

Responsibilities include:

● Running a high file load
● Training and mentoring paralegals and junior lawyers
● Presenting to community groups and organisations
● Business development and key stakeholder relations
● Precedent development

● Practised exclusively in the area of wills and estates and had extensive experience in the area of wills, powers of attorney and VCAT related issues / disputes, basic estate planning, superannuation death benefit claims and disputes, administration of estates (probate) and estate litigation, including applications to remove executors / trustees and challenges to wills. 

● Acted for many of Australia’s leading charities in relation to their wills and bequest work and volunteered at their will’s days.

● Was a regular speaker to community groups across Melbourne and the Mornington Peninsula such as Probus, Rotary and The Self Help Addiction Resource Centre.

● Was instrumental in the introduction of using Google Adwords for the department.

Sample of matters involved with:
● Elder abuse
● Traffic infringements
● Fencing disputes
● Debts
● Wills and Powers of Attorney

● Designed and implemented Continuing Professional Development (CPD) programs onsite and offsite. These programs were aimed at a range of participants from para-legal staff through to senior partners, in-house counsel and government. CPD programs include seminars, workshops, conferences and customized programs.
● Researched and monitored current trends and issues in the legal industry and the professional development needs of Victorian lawyers.
● Taught a full day workshop titled “Introduction to the legal office for legal support staff”.  Students include legal support staff from private law firms, community legal centres, government organisations and in-house legal departments.
● Updated course materials.
● Developed marketing and advertising strategies to increase the profile of Leo Cussen Centre for Law and to expand into new markets.
● Co-presented session titled “Not sitting on the fence - Ethics Essentials for in-house counsel” at ACLA Western Australia Annual Conference, 26 May 2010.

Sample of matters involved with:
● Estate litigation including reported judgements of Anslow v Journeaux & Anor [2009] VSC 250 and Leyden v McVeigh & Anor [2009] VSC 164. 
● Drafting wills and power of attorneys
● Commercial litigation  
● Advised Credit Unions on banking and finance laws, APRA Rules, ASIC Laws and the Corporations Act
● Employment law
● Criminal law

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

Andrea holds bachelor degrees in commerce and law, and she has been practicing law for several years. Before joining Maurice Blackburn in 2013, Andrea worked for another law firm, where she helped clients with WorkCover and medical negligence claims.

Andrea has a strong sense of social justice and knew from a young age that she wanted to pursue a career in which she could help people who have been wronged by others.

"I enjoy working closely with my clients to ensure they are fully aware of their legal entitlements and compensated accordingly,"​ Andrea says.

"I find it most rewarding to see the improvement in a client's quality of life after they receive compensation for the injuries that they have suffered at work."

general.headline: Talent Acquisition Specialist at Clarius/Ignite

jobs.description:
At Beaumont Consulting we are all about “People First”. That’s all people involved in the recruitment process from candidate to hiring manager to broader client stakeholders. It’s how we work with our customers and the way we contribute to the communities in which we are involved that sets us apart. We’ve found that putting people first invariably means that the profits naturally follow. This articulates our entire business philosophy and ensures our continued business success. The difference will make you smile. 

We specialise in all levels of recruitment both temporary and permanent across the industry areas of health & social care and charities, business services, contact centre and sales, education and associations & memberships. We also provide an executive recruitment service across all these sectors.

- Actively target potential clients to win business by building rapport within multiple levels of organizations across multiple industries
- Create a trusting relationship with clients through active listening to understand their needs and providing results that are aligned with those needs
- Showcase honesty and integrity by providing market intelligence to educate clients on remuneration packages from competing businesses
- Provide leadership to the resource team when needed for assistance with urgent positions during peak times by educating them on the client, the idea candidate profile and where and how to locate such candidates
- Act as a patient and problem-solving mediator between clients and candidates during the offer negotiation stage of the process.
- Maintain an organized and detailed log of all stages of the recruitment process for each client on recruitment management system.

- Report into General Manager 
- Develop and maintain an expertise in contemporary best practice talent identification, sourcing and engagement methodologies 
- Provide internal stakeholders with original research and market intelligence to identify top industry talent and ensure the delivery of successful talent acquisition solutions to clients 
- Lead and support candidate management and engagement; act as a point of call for all local and international candidates searching for employment opportunities within Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates. 
- Interview and qualify candidates against core competencies, drivers and motivations, providing career advice and mentoring services. 
- Support the development of recruitment and HR methodologies and drive new internal and external talent development initiatives. 
- Actively business develop potential clients to grow the bottom line of the business through cold and warm calling, face to face meetings and finally, contract signing. 
- Research, develop, and lead internal process development initiatives to ensure efficient delivery of consulting solutions to clients. 
- Develop and maintain strategic long term relationships with key clients and external stakeholders through direct communication, follow-up and closure. 
- Lead training and development for new starters, and corporate social responsibility initiatives in direct partnership with semi-governmental organizations e.g. The Bahrain Labour Fund and Young Arab Leaders, a pan- GCC non-profit body.

jobs.description:
We’re a young Australian start-up delivering happiness to the world.

We do it with a furniture-buying experience that's made for the digital age.

High-quality products that are designed, refined and delivered by a multi-talented team that operates more like a software company than a furniture company.

The results are speaking for themselves … we’ve got some of the happiest customers in Australia.

We’re also proud to support a national icon by adopting a real life koala with every product sold.

An environmentally conscious skin, hair, and body care range crafted locally in Byron Bay from 100% natural, plant-derived ingredients. Inspired by the pristine coastline, lush rainforest and rolling countryside of Bryon Bay, we have created luxurious skincare products free from harsh chemicals using only the finest quality botanical ingredients.

We're focused on more than creating luxurious skincare products, we want to inspire our generation to adopt socially and environmentally responsible lifestyles. We're committed to making a difference, not only with the ingredients we choose but also our One-for-One Tree Planting Program that ensures a tree is planted for every product sold.

Seed The Change is a for-profit subscription-based business that helps eCommerce stores make more sales while helping the environment.

Seed The Change allows vendors to have trees planted in any of 15 locations around the world every time a product is sold on their store.

Seed The Change customers not only increase the perceived value of their product (and therefore their conversion rates) they also position themselves as a social good company.

Seed The Change operates in partnership with a tree-planting charity which has planted over 53 million trees around the globe since 1984.

Part of Ogilvy Australia and the STW group, Data@Ogilvy helps clients leverage the latest advances in technology, big data, and behavioural science to create data-driven customer experiences and drive step change in commercial value. We enable end-to-end digital and transformation programmes.

– Using existing APIs to integrate disparate technologies into automation systems, custom web/mobile applications and dashboard tools

Toppit is a fun new way to challenge, compete, and motivate friends from everyday habits to even the most adventurous of challenges. Now you have the opportunity to create challenges using a photo of the pizza you made, the sunset you saw, or even a video of a kickflip you just landed. 

Submitted entries go up on a scoreboard, and it’s then up to your friends and followers to vote for the winner.

There has never been a platform with such unlimited possibilities and ways to compete.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zv3kOKKwylA
